title.rendered: A Complete Guide About Search Engine Optimization Pricing

content.rendered:
Search engine optimization is broad and there are several options available in the market that sometimes make business owners confused. To clear the air, we have done complete research on search engine optimization pricing for you.

Whether you are just starting your online business or already running your business, this guide will help you with everything that you need to know about SEO pricing. Before getting into types of SEO pricing models, first, understand important factors that influence the overall SEO price of a project.

Table of Contents

Toggle
  • Website size
  • Link Acquisition
  • Website’s technical aspect
  • Competition
  • SEO monthly plan
  • Hourly model
  • Project basis

Website size

The first thing that influences the overall search engine optimization pricing is the number of pages a website has. More pages will need more time and resources and hence the price will increase accordingly. 

Link Acquisition

The number and the quality of links also determine the price of the SEO service. Acquiring high domain authority links requires both time and resources. If a website’s domain authority is lower and requires to gather high DA links, the price will increase. 

Website’s technical aspect

A Website’s technical condition also determines the total work that needs to be done on the site. If a website has many 404 errors, redirects, page loading issues; then the SEO professionals need more time to first fix these issues and then start the optimization process. 

Competition

The SEO price varies depending upon the keywords you need to rank for your website. If the keywords are highly competitive, then it will require more time, and resources to make it happen.

These were some of the most important things that influence the price of overall SEO prices for your website. Now, let’s have a look at types of search engine optimization pricing models.

SEO monthly plan

SEO monthly plans or packages are the most popular option that you have for your website as they are affordable, effective and you don’t need to make significant investments to begin the optimization process. In the SEO monthly plan, you pay a fixed price every month to retain the services. The services can cost you anywhere around $250 to $1300 per month depending upon the above factors.

Hourly model

Hourly SEO model is an advanced SEO pricing model in which you pay according to the number of hours SEO executives have worked on your website. It’s an expensive SEO pricing model compared to the monthly plan as the average hourly price starts anywhere from $50 to $200. For example, if the SEO professional has worked for 12 hours a week at the rate of $150, then you need to pay around $1,800 for the job done. 

Project basis

The project basis pricing model is popular among people who understand SEO inside out and they need some personalization on the work done over their website. In this model, you pay anywhere around $2,000 to $10,000 per month for each project. If you want to implement advanced SEO practices on your website and customization, then it’s the best model for your website. 

These are the key factors and search engine optimization pricing models that you need to know as you opt for a service.
